properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces targeted 10 infrastructure facilities in the temporarily occupied territories of Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia regions, and Crimea. Additionally, 2 facilities within Russia were also struck. Reports indicate damage to the Rosneft Tuapse oil refinery and other infrastructure, resulting in civilian injuries.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Strikes Oil Depot in Rybinsk
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, a fire occurred at the FSKU 'Temp' oil depot in Rybinsk, Yaroslavl region, following drone strikes attributed to Ukrainian forces. The depot is approximately 700 kilometers from the front line and serves as a significant storage and distribution point for petroleum products in the North-Eastern region of the Russian Federation.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack Odesa Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian Forces conducted drone strikes in the Odesa region, targeting civilian and energy infrastructure. Reports indicate significant damage to two energy facilities and a logistics company's warehouses, which were previously utilized for military purposes. Recovery efforts are expected to take time.

properties.title: Russian Forces Target Infrastructure in Odesa Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Ukrainian President Zelensky reported that Russian forces are attempting to isolate the Odesa region by targeting port infrastructure, impacting civilian areas and economic activities. On December 31, drone strikes reportedly hit logistics warehouses and residential buildings in Odesa, causing damage to civilian infrastructure.

properties.title: Ukrainian Air Defense Units Repel Drone Attack in Sumy Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Air Defense Units of the 47th OMB utilized STING interceptor drones to engage and neutralize 22 Russian drone targets over a period of 6 hours in the Sumy region.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Fuel Tanks near Kirovske
properties.description: On December 26, 2025, Ukrainian Forces conducted a drone strike that resulted in the destruction of four 50,000-liter fuel tanks near Kirovske, Crimea. Additional strikes on December 28 targeted a Border Guard facility near Chornomorske and radar infrastructure near Olenivka.

properties.title: Alleged Drone Attack Reported on Presidential Residence in Moscow
properties.description: Reports indicate that there was an alleged drone attack on a presidential residence in Moscow. The Russian side claims Ukrainian drones were involved, while Ukrainian officials have denied these allegations. The situation arises amid ongoing negotiations for a peace agreement.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Report on Valdai Residence Attack Claims
properties.description: Ukrainian President Zelensky stated that reports of an attack on President Putin's Valdai residence are false. He mentioned discussions with American negotiators regarding the situation and indicated that the claims could be verified as untrue. The context of the statement included references to recent diplomatic meetings.

properties.title: Russian Propaganda Broadcasts Threats to Ukraine
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, a broadcast from the Russian military communication station UVB-76 included threats directed at Ukraine, referencing missile strikes on Kyiv. The station, typically used for military roll calls, also played the ballet 'Swan Lake'.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Attack Reported near Russian Presidential Residence
properties.description: Reports indicate a drone attack targeting the residence of the President of the Russian Federation. The Russian government has not disclosed the President's location following the incident. There are claims of ongoing military responses to perceived threats against Russian citizens, with calls for effective action against adversary forces.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Civilian Ships near Port
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian Forces targeted two civilian vessels, 'Emmakris III' and 'Captain Karam', with UAVs while they were approaching a port to load wheat. Reports indicate injuries among the crew.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Destroy Russian Tank and Infantry Fighting Vehicle in Zaporizhzhia
properties.description: In the Zaporizhzhia direction, Ukrainian Forces reported the destruction of a Russian tank and an infantry fighting vehicle. The Russian Forces abandoned the vehicles during a mechanized assault.

properties.title: Evacuation Decision Implemented in Chernihiv Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, authorities in the Chernihiv region decided to evacuate 14 border villages, including Novgorod-Siverska, Semenivska, Snovska, and Gorodnyanska communities, due to ongoing shelling in border areas.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack Ports in Odesa Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian Forces conducted an attack on the ports of Pivdennyi and Chornomorsk in the Odesa region. The attack resulted in damage to a civilian ship registered under the Panamanian flag and storage tanks for vegetable oil. The extent of the damage to the infrastructure is currently being assessed.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Raids near Dronivka
properties.description: Russian Forces continue operations across the Siversky Donets River, attempting to advance towards Dronivka from multiple directions. Ukrainian Forces report ongoing raids from Siversk and attempts to cross the Bakhmutovka River. In the past week, Ukrainian Forces have reported the destruction of 54 Russian Army personnel, 3 motorcycles, 1 ATV, and 1 rubber motorized boat in the area.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Operations in Kupiansk
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces are completing operations in Kupiansk, with reports indicating reduced activity from Russian Forces in the city. The central area remains a challenge, with Ukrainian Forces aiming to secure control. The situation is evolving, with expectations of further developments in the near future.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Attacks in Sumy Region
properties.description: Russian Forces have established positions in Andriivka and are conducting attacks towards Nova Sich, aiming to reach operational space in Sumy. They are also attempting to displace Ukrainian Forces from Oleksiyivka. In the Hrabivske direction, Russian Forces have been largely halted, but they advanced approximately 1 km near Vysoke. New combat activities have been reported in Komarivka near Esman.

properties.title: Russian Forces Claim Drone Destruction in Moscow Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian authorities reported the interception of 21 drones in the Moscow Region across seven municipalities. One drone reportedly crashed in the village of Pagubino, injuring a 57-year-old man. Emergency services responded promptly, and the individual was transported to a trauma center with shrapnel wounds. The situation remains under investigation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in City Center
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces continue to advance in the city center, having secured additional districts. Clashes persist as approximately 15 Russian Forces personnel attempt to hold their positions. Ukrainian Forces have taken control of the auto college and the DOSAAF enterprise. The situation remains fluid with ongoing combat. Russian Forces maintain fire control over city entrances, complicating movement into the area.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attempt Attack in Kupiansk
properties.description: Russian Forces launched an attack in the northern part of Kupiansk, reaching the northern stele but were repelled. Over 60 personnel were evacuated from the city. Ukrainian Forces maintained control despite Russian Forces demolishing buildings to hinder operations. In the Zaoskillya area, Russian Forces deployed over 30 personnel to local enterprises, while Ukrainian Forces engaged in counteractions.

properties.title: Russian Forces Increase Activity in Sumy Region
properties.description: Russian Forces have resumed operations in the Sumy region, particularly around Kostiantynivka and Oleksiivka, with an increase in infantry assaults on Ukrainian Forces positions. Minimal territorial advances have been reported. Concerns exist regarding potential strategic missteps similar to previous engagements.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Counterattack near Grabovske
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Ukrainian Forces attempted a counterattack with two assault groups in the Grabovske area but did not achieve success. Russian Forces are reportedly redeploying strategic reserves to regain lost positions and strengthen defensive lines. Civilian casualties were reported due to drone strikes in various locations, including the Kherson region and Belgorod.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Cafe in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Ukrainian Forces conducted a strike on a cafe in the Kherson region. The incident resulted in civilian casualties, and the long-term consequences of this action are anticipated to be significant.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Strike on Civilian Targets in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Ukrainian Forces conducted a drone strike targeting civilian objects in the village of Khoryly, resulting in 53 casualties, including 24 fatalities. The attack occurred near midnight, with reports of a fire caused by incendiary munitions. A reconnaissance drone was noted prior to the strike. Additional drone activity was reported, including interceptions of Ukrainian drones over Russian territories.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Drone Strikes in Odesa Region
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Russian Forces executed drone strikes targeting energy infrastructure in the Odesa region, damaging several substations. Power outages continued in various areas, including Kyiv. Ukrainian Forces engaged in heavy fighting in the Sumy direction, with advancements reported near Kondaтrovka and Alekseevka. In the Burok direction, Russian Forces continued their offensive, capturing parts of Staritsa and engaging in combat near Volchansk.

properties.title: Russian Forces Advance near Sumy Region
properties.description: Clashes continue in the Sumy direction, particularly around Kondratovka and Alekseevka. Russian units have regained control over most of Andreevka, though adversary forces remain present. Fighting persists near Yunakovka, with Ukrainian Forces attempting to maneuver through fields, incurring casualties. Russian Forces are approximately 20 kilometers from Sumy, where adversary forces have established numerous strongpoints in difficult terrain.

properties.title: Russian Forces Advance near Volchansk
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Russian Forces continued their advance in the Burlyuk direction, achieving local successes around Volchansk. Control was established over parts of the settlement of Staritsa, and clashes occurred in the vicinity of Liman and Volchanskie Khutory. Ongoing confrontations were reported in Degtyarnoye, Ambarnoe, and Dvurechanskoye with no changes in control zones.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Operation at Antonovsky Bridge
properties.description: In summer 2025, Russian Forces initiated an operation to secure the Antonovsky railway bridge area, previously used by Ukrainian Forces for operations. A small group of five reconnaissance personnel from the 127th Brigade faced challenges including drone surveillance and counterattacks from a reinforced Ukrainian unit. The operation followed ongoing clashes in the Kherson region since late 2022.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Strike in Krasnodar Krai
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, a drone strike in Tuapse, Krasnodar Krai, resulted in two injuries and damage to five houses, a port pier, and equipment at a refinery. In the Moscow region, one drone was destroyed, and a civilian was injured in the village of Pagubino. Over 100 drones were reported destroyed in various regions, including Crimea and Belgorod. Casualties were reported in multiple locations due to drone attacks.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Attacks on Ukrainian Energy Infrastructure
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian Forces targeted energy facilities in the Chernihiv region, resulting in widespread power outages. Attacks also occurred in the Sumy region and continued against port infrastructure in the Odesa region. The situation in Kyiv remains critical with ongoing power shortages. Ukrainian Forces are facing challenges in maintaining energy supply across affected areas.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Operations near Orikhiv
properties.description: On the Zaporizhzhia front, Russian Forces launched attacks towards Orikhiv, but did not achieve significant advances. Ukrainian Forces maintain control over Novodanylivka and Mala Tokmachka, which are in a contested area. Clashes occurred in the vicinity of Stepove and Malye Shcherbaki, with Russian Forces reportedly advancing towards Lukyanivske. The situation remains fluid with both sides unable to establish firm control in several areas.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in Kupiansk
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces have reportedly penetrated deeper into Kupiansk, occupying the building of a kindergarten. Russian Forces have withdrawn from central positions to avoid encirclement. Control remains over the Kupiansk Sugar Factory and part of a dairy plant. Ukrainian formations have been observed near a local school, while Russian drone operators conduct strikes to prevent the establishment of defensive positions by Ukrainian Forces.

properties.title: Attack on Presidential Residence Reported
properties.description: An attack on a presidential residence was reported, with implications for ongoing peace negotiations. The residence, located in Valdai, has not been actively used and is primarily maintained by staff. The attack is viewed as a potential escalation in military actions, with predictions of continued conflict. The strategic motivations behind the attack remain unclear, with speculation about involvement from various parties.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Operations in Donbass Region
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces engaged in operations targeting Ukrainian Forces in the Donbass region, specifically in the Sumy and Krasnoliman directions. Reports indicate that 85 personnel were affected during these operations.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Russian Artillery Unit near Kupiansk
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, a Ukrainian FPV drone successfully targeted and destroyed a 2S1 self-propelled artillery unit in the Kupiansk direction. The operation was conducted by a group identified as 'Antagonist'.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes across Ukraine
properties.description: On January 1-2, 2026, Russian Forces executed multiple strikes targeting various regions in Ukraine, including Donbas, Sumy, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Kherson. The strikes involved various munitions, resulting in numerous explosions reported throughout the day. Specific locations included Izmail, Zaporizhzhia, and Kyiv, among others.

properties.title: Russian Forces Destroy Ukrainian Tank in Kupiansk Direction
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, a Ukrainian tank was destroyed in the Kupiansk direction by a strike from a group identified as 'Antagonist'. The tank was completely destroyed due to the impact and subsequent detonation.

properties.title: Russian Forces Target Ukrainian Artillery in Donbass
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Russian Forces engaged in combat operations resulting in the destruction of a 2S22 Bohdana self-propelled howitzer belonging to Ukrainian Forces in the Sumy direction of the Donbass region. A total of 51 targets were reported hit during the operations.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes in Ukraine on December 30-31, 2025
properties.description: On December 30-31, 2025, Russian Forces conducted multiple strikes across various regions in Ukraine, including Donbas, Sumy, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Kherson. Reports indicate explosions in Uman, Odesa, Ilyichivsk, Mykolaiv, and Kyiv, among others, with specific times noted for each incident. The strikes involved various munitions and targeted both urban and rural areas.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Operations in Donbass Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian Forces engaged in operations targeting Ukrainian Forces in the Donbass region, specifically in the Sumy and Krasnoliman directions. Reports indicate that 109 targets were affected during these operations.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes on Ukrainian Energy Infrastructure in Multiple Regions
properties.description: On December 29-30, 2025, Russian Forces targeted energy facilities in Ukraine, resulting in explosions in Chernihiv, Sumy, and Zaporizhzhia regions. Significant damage was reported to substations, leading to widespread power outages. Additionally, attacks on port infrastructure in Odesa were noted, affecting vessels and storage facilities. The situation in Kyiv region remains critical with ongoing power shortages.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike in Kherson Region
properties.description: The number of casualties from a strike in the Kherson region has increased to 27, including two children. Currently, 31 individuals are hospitalized, five of whom are minors. Identification of the deceased may take considerable time, with some cases requiring genetic testing for confirmation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces UAVs Engaged in Airspace over Russian Regions
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, air defense systems intercepted 64 Ukrainian UAVs in various regions of Russia. The interceptions occurred over Samara (20), Voronezh (8), Saratov (8), Moscow (7), Ryazan (6), Rostov (6), Tula (3), and one each over Kursk, Kaluga, Penza, and Tambov. The target in Samara was a refinery.

properties.title: Ukrainian Official Meets Turkish Foreign Minister in Ankara
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Rustem Umerov, head of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine, met with Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan in Ankara to discuss security issues and prisoner exchanges. Ten individuals injured in a strike in the Kherson region were reported to have been transported to Crimea, including five children and a pregnant woman, with medical personnel attending to their injuries.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Strike in Tarasivka Area
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, a drone strike attributed to Ukrainian Forces targeted a civilian vehicle in the Tarasivka area of Kherson Oblast. A 5-year-old child sustained fatal injuries and died at the scene. The child's mother, grandfather, and grandmother were injured and are reported to be in serious condition, receiving medical attention.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Drone Strike in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, a drone strike by Ukrainian Forces targeted a civilian vehicle in the vicinity of Tarasivka, Kherson region. Reports indicate that there were casualties, including at least one child. Emergency services were delayed in their response due to ongoing drone activity in the area.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Drone Strike on Civilian Targets in Khoryly
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Ukrainian Forces reportedly conducted a drone strike targeting civilian objects in the village of Khoryly, resulting in 53 injuries and 24 fatalities, including children. The attack occurred during New Year's celebrations, with one drone carrying incendiary materials causing a significant fire. An investigation has been initiated, and there were reports of a subsequent strike on first responders.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Not Targeting Russian President in Drone Incident
properties.description: U.S. national security officials reported that Ukraine did not target President Vladimir Putin or his residence in a recent drone incident. This conclusion was reached by the CIA and NSA, which briefed President Trump on their findings. The reports contradict claims made by Russian authorities regarding an alleged assassination attempt.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Attack on Civilian Locations in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Ukrainian Forces conducted a drone attack in the Kherson region, resulting in 24 fatalities and 50 injuries among civilians. The attack targeted a café and a hotel during New Year celebrations. Emergency services faced difficulties in responding due to ongoing drone activity in the area.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Attack Reported near Putin's Residence
properties.description: On December 29, 2025, Ukrainian Forces launched 91 drones from Sumy and Chernihiv regions targeting the residence of the President of the Russian Federation. The Russian Aerospace Forces reported intercepting all drones by 19:20 Moscow time, with no damage to the residence confirmed.

properties.title: Ukrainian Energy Facilities Damaged in Odesa Region
properties.description: Ukrainian DTEK reported that two energy facilities in the Odesa region were struck, resulting in significant damage that will require time for recovery. Additionally, storage facilities of Nova Poshta were also affected. These facilities have been utilized by adversary forces for logistical purposes, including the storage of Western-supplied weaponry.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Drone Operations Reported over Black Sea and Regions
properties.description: During the night, Ukrainian Forces reportedly launched drone operations resulting in the interception of 86 UAVs. The majority, 56 UAVs, were intercepted over the Black Sea. Additional interceptions included 9 UAVs over Bryansk, 8 over Lipetsk and Crimea, and 5 over Krasnodar.

properties.title: Drone Strike on Novokuybyshevsk Oil Refinery
properties.description: Russian sources report a drone strike on the Novokuybyshevsk oil refinery in Samara Oblast. At least ten explosions were recorded, resulting in large fires at the Rosneft-owned facility. A drone alert was issued across the region prior to the incident.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Repelled Drone Attack across Ukraine
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Ukrainian Forces repelled a drone attack involving 116 UAVs, including approximately 70 Shaheds. As of 08:30, air defenses had shot down or jammed 86 drones. Strikes impacted 23 sites, with debris falling on 2 locations.

properties.title: Russian Forces Claim Evidence of Ukrainian Drone Targeting Residence in Moscow
properties.description: Russian military officials presented what they claim is evidence of a Ukrainian drone aimed at a government residence in Moscow. The evidence includes a flight controller and decoded data. Reports indicate that the drone was intercepted by Russian air defense systems before reaching its target.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Targets in Occupied Donetsk
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces conducted operations using FP-2 drones, targeting a command post of Russian Forces' 68th Assault Battalion near Avdiivka, a fuel depot in Ilovaisk utilized by the 51st Army, and a Shahed drone warehouse at Donetsk airport.

properties.title: CIA Assessment on Drone Strike Attempt on Putin's Residence
properties.description: The CIA assessed that Ukrainian forces did not target a residence of President Putin in a recent drone incident, contradicting claims made by Russian officials. The assessment was communicated to President Trump by CIA Director John Ratcliffe. Meanwhile, the Russian Ministry of Defense reported that it provided data from a downed Ukrainian drone to a US military attaché, alleging that the drone was involved in an attack on the presidential residence.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Strikes on Targets in Russia and Occupied Territories
properties.description: On December 30-31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces utilized unmanned systems to strike 10 targets, including oil refineries and military installations in occupied territories and deep within Russian territory. Notable targets included an oil refinery, fuel depots, and radar sites. Casualties included nine personnel from Russian Forces.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Drone and Missile Strikes in Ukraine
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russian forces launched drone and missile strikes targeting Odesa, Dnipropetrovsk region, and Volyn. Over 100,000 residents in Volyn experienced power outages. Residential buildings in Odesa and Dnipropetrovsk sustained damage, with fires reported but subsequently contained.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Strikes on Targets in Russian Territory
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Unmanned Systems Forces targeted 10 locations, including oil refineries and military depots, in occupied territories and within Russia. Notable targets included an oil refinery in Tatarstan and radar sites in Crimea. Two oil refineries and a TOR air defense system were reported damaged.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Strike on Ilsky Oil Refinery in Krasnodar Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, a drone strike targeted the Ilsky Oil Refinery in the Krasnodar region, marking the first Russian refinery hit in 2026. A swarm of drones engaged Russian air defense, resulting in the destruction of the defense system and the refinery. Nine Russian personnel were reported killed during the operation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Attack Ongoing on Russian Territory
properties.description: A series of drone and missile attacks are reported targeting Russian and occupied territories, including Moscow and Crimea. Ukrainian Forces are deploying numerous drones in these operations. In response, Russian air defense systems have intercepted multiple drones over various regions.

properties.title: Ukrainian MiG-29 Strike on Russian Troop Concentration near Konkivskyi Bridge
properties.description: A Ukrainian MiG-29 conducted an airstrike using a French AASM-250 guided bomb targeting a concentration of Russian forces near the Konkivskyi Bridge in the Kherson region. The strike was reported as precise.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Long-Range Strikes Inside Russia
properties.description: In late December 2025, Ukrainian Forces executed multiple long-range strikes targeting strategic locations within Russian territory. Notable attacks included oil refineries and military infrastructure in the Luhansk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia regions, and Crimea, utilizing drones and other munitions.

properties.title: Ukrainian Special Operations Forces Strike Tamanneftegaz Port Terminal in Krasnodar Region
properties.description: On the night of December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Special Operations Forces targeted the Tamanneftegaz port terminal in Russia's Krasnodar region, disabling key infrastructure using drones. Additionally, Ukrainian forces destroyed ammunition depots belonging to Russian Forces in occupied Donetsk, impacting logistics hubs in Blyzhnie and Siyatel.

properties.title: Power and Water Disruptions Reported in Domodedovo
properties.description: Disruptions to power, water, and heating services have been reported across most of Domodedovo, a suburb near Moscow. The situation is being monitored by local authorities. Ongoing military activities may impact civilian infrastructure.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Target Russian Air Defense Systems
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Unmanned Systems drones from the 'Asgard' battalion of Ukraine’s 412th Brigade 'Nemesis' destroyed two Russian air defense systems, a Buk-M3 and a Tor-M2, on the Huliaipole and Orikhiv fronts within one hour.

properties.title: Alleged Drone Attack Reported on Putin's Residence
properties.description: The Russian Ministry of Defense reported an alleged drone attack on President Putin's residence in Valdai, claiming it was a coordinated strike from the Sumy and Chernihiv regions. No damage or casualties were reported. Additionally, some experts suggested alternative launch sites, including regions within Russia and potentially Latvia. A blackout affecting 120,000 people in the Moscow region was also reported, attributed to an electrical cable fire.

properties.title: Ukrainian Unmanned Systems Forces Conduct Strikes in Occupied Regions
properties.description: Ukrainian Unmanned Systems Forces executed precision strikes targeting various locations in occupied Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, and Crimea. Key targets included an oil depot in Rovenky, a radar station and boat base in Olenivka, and multiple troop positions in Selydove. Additional assessments are ongoing regarding deep-strike targets within Russia.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Strike on Rosneft Tuapse Oil Refinery
properties.description: A Ukrainian drone strike targeted the Rosneft Tuapse oil refinery, resulting in flames and damage to a port pier, residential structures, and a gas pipeline. Two civilians sustained injuries during the incident.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Strikes Reported at Oil Depot in Rybinsk
properties.description: A fire occurred at the FSKU 'Temp' oil depot of the Russian State Reserve in Rybinsk, Yaroslavl region, following reported Ukrainian drone strikes. The depot is approximately 700 km from the front line. The facility is significant for the storage and distribution of petroleum products in the northeastern region of Russia.

properties.title: Power Restoration Efforts Ongoing in Ramenskoye near Moscow
properties.description: Mobile generators are being deployed in Ramenskoye, indicating challenges in restoring power following recent disruptions. Quick restoration efforts have not been successful.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Operations Against Russian Forces
properties.description: In 2025, the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) reported on various operations, including the destruction of strategic aircraft, a submarine strike in Novorossiysk, and drone attacks on oil refineries, resulting in significant reductions in exports and hardware losses for Russian Forces. Footage of a drone strike on a Russian oil platform in the Caspian Sea was also released.

properties.title: Total Blackout Reported in Moscow
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, over 600,000 residents in Moscow experienced a total blackout. The cause of the blackout has not been officially confirmed. This incident follows earlier reports of a drone swarm targeting the region, attributed to Ukrainian forces.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Swarm Reported near Moscow
properties.description: Power outages were reported in the Moscow region on December 30, 2025, following the approach of a large Ukrainian drone swarm. The cause of the power outages remains officially unconfirmed.

properties.title: Russian Drones Attack Civilian Cargo Ships near Odesa
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Russian drones targeted the cargo ships Emmakris III and Captain Karam as they approached Odesa port to load wheat. Reports indicate civilian casualties and injuries among personnel.

properties.title: Russian Radio Station Broadcasts Threats Against Ukraine
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, the Russian UVB-76 radio station, also known as 'The Buzzer', transmitted a broadcast that included music and threats directed at Ukraine. This marked the first instance of music being aired on the station since its inception in 1976. The content included references to military actions against Kyiv.

properties.title: Event Processing Error
properties.description: Data could not be summarized neutrally.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Engage Russian Forces in Kupyansk
properties.description: In Kupyansk, Ukrainian Forces reportedly advanced deeper into the city, with footage indicating occupation of a kindergarten. Russian Forces maintain control of the sugar factory and part of the dairy complex, repelling Ukrainian counterattacks. The situation remains complex, with adverse weather affecting operations for both sides.

properties.title: Ukrainian Intelligence Operation Conducted to Mislead Russian Forces
properties.description: Ukrainian intelligence executed a multi-phase operation to simulate the death of Denis Kapustin, commander of the Russian Volunteer Corps. A video was produced showing a drone attack on a minibus, which was accepted by Russian forces as evidence of the assassination. Funds intended for the operation were intercepted and will be redirected to enhance the capabilities of Ukrainian special forces.

properties.title: Russian Authorities Claim Ukrainian Drone Targeted Putin's Residence
properties.description: On December 29, 2025, Russian authorities reported that a Ukrainian drone allegedly aimed to strike a structure within the presidential residence in Novgorod. The Russian Ministry of Defense stated that they decoded the flight plan of a downed drone and provided technical evidence to the U.S. embassy in Moscow. No independent confirmations of these claims have been reported.

properties.title: New Year Observance in Ukraine
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, at midnight, the city of Kyiv experienced a silent New Year without celebrations, fireworks, or crowds. This stark contrast to other global capitals highlights the ongoing situation in Ukraine. The absence of typical festivities serves as a reminder of the current circumstances faced by the civilian population.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Attack Civilian Locations in Kherson Oblast
properties.description: At midnight on January 1, 2026, a bar and hotel in Khorly, Kherson Oblast were struck by drones. Russian officials report 24 fatalities, including one child, and 50 injuries. The situation is under investigation, with conflicting reports regarding responsibility.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Engage Russian Forces in Stepnohirsk
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces conducted operations against Russian Forces in a multi-storey residential building in Stepnohirsk. The operation involved the use of TM-62 mines to target buildings occupied by Russian personnel.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Drone Strikes on Targets in Russia
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces utilized unmanned aerial vehicles to strike 10 targets, including an oil refinery in the Krasnodar region and military infrastructure in occupied territories. The strikes occurred shortly before midnight, targeting both military and energy facilities.

properties.title: Ukrainian UAV Flight Paths Reported
properties.description: Approximate flight paths of Ukrainian UAVs have been reported, indicating directions of attack UAVs, reaction UAVs, and cruise missiles. All information on the routes is sourced from Russian sources.

properties.title: Drone Attack Reported near Moscow
properties.description: A drone attack targeting Russian territory was reported, with multiple drones heading towards Moscow and occupied Crimea. U.S. national-security officials stated that Ukraine did not target President Vladimir Putin or his residences in this incident. A blackout affecting 120,000 people in the Moscow region was also reported, attributed to an electrical cable fire.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Advance in Kupiansk
properties.description: Heavy fighting continues in Kupiansk, with Ukrainian Forces reportedly penetrating deeper into the city. Russian Forces maintain control of the sugar factory and part of the dairy complex, repelling counterattacks. Ukrainian Forces have deployed reserves to disrupt Russian tactical formations. Weather conditions are affecting operations for both sides. Reports indicate that Russian claims of control over the city may not reflect the actual situation on the ground.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Key Russian Energy Infrastructure in Krasnodar Region
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces conducted drone strikes on multiple targets in the Krasnodar region, including the Tuapse oil refinery and the Tamanneftegaz port terminal. Damage was reported to primary oil processing facilities, two piers, and ammunition depots in Donetsk. The strikes aimed to disrupt Russian logistics and energy capabilities.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Engage Russian Drone in Donetsk Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces successfully targeted a Russian FPV drone using small arms fire while it attempted to conduct an attack in the Donetsk region. No casualties reported.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Attack Oil Depot in Rybinsk
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, an oil depot located in Rybinsk, Yaroslavl region, was reported to be on fire. The facility is part of the state-owned 'Temp' plant of Rosrezerva, significant for the storage and distribution of petroleum products in the northeastern region of Russia. The geographical coordinates of the site are 58.0250338045, 38.9452206420.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Attacks on Russian Energy Infrastructure
properties.description: In December 2025, Ukrainian Forces executed a series of attacks on Russian energy infrastructure, totaling at least 26 strikes against refineries, oil tankers, and maritime infrastructure. This marks the highest number of attacks recorded during the conflict, impacting Russian oil exports and revenue. Concurrently, Russian Forces continued bombardments on Ukrainian infrastructure.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Operations in Yarovaya and Sosnovoe Villages
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces conducted operations in the villages of Yarovaya and Sosnovoe, located in the Donetsk region. The activities were documented by members of the Ukrainian unit 'OnlyWars' using GoPro cameras. Details regarding casualties or specific engagements were not provided.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack on Naval Vessels in Odessa Port
properties.description: On December 26, 2025, Russian Forces reportedly conducted an attack on naval vessels located in the port of Odessa. The incident was geolocated, and three separate strikes were noted. The presence of anti-aircraft defenses in the area appears to be absent. Verification of these details is pending.

properties.title: Russian Forces Launch Drone Attacks in Odessa Region
properties.description: On December 30-31, 2025, Russian Forces launched 127 attack drones, including approximately 80 Shahed drones, targeting multiple locations in the Odessa region. Ukrainian Forces intercepted or jammed 101 drones, while at least 20 drones struck 11 sites, causing damage to civilian infrastructure, including a logistics company's warehouses and a high-rise building.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Tuapse Oil Refinery in Russia
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces conducted strikes on the Tuapse oil refinery, damaging the ELOU-AVT-12 unit and deep processing systems. Additional targets included the Tamanneftegaz export terminal, two piers, a Rosrezerv oil depot in Rybinsk, a riverboat base in Crimea, and ammunition depots in Blyzhnie and Siyatel.

properties.title: European Leaders Discuss Coordinated Position on Ukraine
properties.description: European leaders held an emergency meeting to discuss their coordinated stance on Ukraine following Russia's announcement of a change in negotiation position. This change was prompted by Ukrainian drone activity targeting the Russian presidential residence. The Kremlin indicated that it would not accept certain terms in the proposed peace agreement, which has been reduced from 28 to 20 points.

properties.title: Air Defense Forces Intercept Drones in Moscow Region
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, air defense forces in the Moscow Region intercepted and suppressed 21 drones across seven municipalities. One drone fell in the village of Pagubino, injuring a 57-year-old man, who was transported to a trauma center with shrapnel wounds. Emergency services responded promptly to the incident.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Attack Resulting in Power Outage in Moscow
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Ukrainian Forces conducted an attack that resulted in a partial power outage in Moscow. Auxiliary diesel generators were reportedly activated in response to the situation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Multiple Targets in Temporarily Occupied Territories
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces targeted several locations in temporarily occupied territories, including an oil depot in Rovenki, a floating base in Olenivka, a radar station in Olenivka, and multiple deployment points of Russian Forces in Selydove. Additional strikes were reported at Melitopol and Molochansk airfields.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Drone Strikes in Melitopol
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Melitopol, a city in Ukraine, experienced a blackout following drone strikes. The governor of the occupied Zaporizhia region, Yevgeny Balitsky, reassured citizens that air defense systems were operational. Concurrently, power outages were reported in Moscow, with no official explanation provided. This occurred shortly after reports of a large swarm of Ukrainian drones targeting the Russian capital.

properties.title: Ukrainian Air Defense Units Intercept Drone Attack in Sumy Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Air Defense Units of the 47th OMB utilized STING interceptors from the 'Wild Hornets' to counter a drone attack by Russian Forces in the Sumy region. A total of 22 targets were reported downed over a period of 6 hours.

properties.title: Russian Forces Engage in Combat Operations near Kupiansk
properties.description: Ongoing combat operations near Kupiansk have highlighted a personnel deficit within the Russian Forces. Reports indicate that drone operators are working continuously to support ground troops. The effectiveness of Russian defensive positions is attributed to the efforts of these operators, despite challenges posed by small unit tactics employed by both sides.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Assault near Dobropillia
properties.description: Russian Forces, led by Lieutenant General Sukhrob Akhmedov, attempted an assault utilizing a T-80BMV tank equipped with a section of a TMM-3 heavy mechanized bridge. The operation aimed to facilitate the crossing of water obstacles by following units but resulted in failure.

properties.title: Russian Forces Deploy Armored Vehicles near Belgorod
properties.description: Armored vehicles have been allocated to the 'Orlan' detachment for operations in the border area of the Belgorod region. The deployment is part of ongoing military activities in the vicinity.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Attack on Logistics Center at Donetsk Airport
properties.description: On December 30, 2025, Ukrainian Forces targeted multiple locations at the Donetsk Airport, including the logistics center and ammunition storage for the Geran/Shahid systems. The attack affected various points of the terminal and surrounding areas, impacting personnel and equipment preparation facilities.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Drone Strike on Ukrainian Positions in Semenivka
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces utilized kamikaze drones, specifically the 'Geran', to target and destroy the launch and control points of Ukrainian drone operators in the city of Semenivka, Chernihiv Oblast.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes Across Ukraine
properties.description: On December 30-31, 2025, Russian Forces launched strikes targeting various locations in Ukraine, including Donbas, Sumy, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Kherson regions. Explosions were reported in Uman, Odesa, Illichivsk, Mykolaiv, Kyiv, and other areas. The strikes involved multiple types of munitions, with specific incidents noted throughout the day.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Drone Strikes in Krasnodar Krai
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces conducted drone strikes in Krasnodar Krai, resulting in two injuries and damage to five houses, a port pier, and equipment at a refinery. In the evening, a kamikaze drone struck a vehicle in Bryansk Oblast, injuring a civilian. Ongoing clashes were reported in Sumy region, with Ukrainian Forces engaging in combat operations.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Attack Alleged on Putin's Residence
properties.description: The Kremlin reported an alleged Ukrainian drone attack on the residence of President Putin. In response, the Kremlin indicated a potential hardening of its stance in ongoing negotiations. Concurrently, reports indicated drone activity in various regions, with casualties and property damage reported in Krasnodar Krai and other areas.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Attempt Attack on Putin's Residence
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Ukrainian Forces reportedly attempted an attack on the residence of Russian President Vladimir Putin. The incident has drawn attention from various media outlets, highlighting the ongoing tensions between the two nations. No confirmed casualties or damage have been reported.

properties.title: Drone Strike Allegation Reported near Putin's Residence
properties.description: Reports emerged regarding a potential drone strike on the residence of Russian President Vladimir Putin in the Novgorod region. The CIA and NSA concluded that Ukraine did not attempt such an action. CIA Director John Ratcliffe briefed President Trump on these findings, which were followed by media coverage attributing blame to Russia for hindering peace efforts.

properties.title: Allegations of Drone Attack on Russian Presidential Residence
properties.description: Reports indicate that Russian authorities have accused Ukrainian forces of conducting a drone attack targeting the residence of President Putin. The CIA has stated that neither the residence nor President Putin was the intended target. The situation remains under investigation, with various sources providing differing accounts.

properties.title: Alleged Attack on Putin's Residence Reported
properties.description: Reports indicate that Russia has made allegations regarding a supposed attack on the residence of President Putin. The Russian military has presented materials related to these claims. Further details can be found in the provided sources.

properties.title: Allegations of Drone Attack on Putin's Residence
properties.description: Reports indicate that the Russian government condemned a drone attack allegedly targeting the residence of President Putin. Various sources have cited accusations against Ukrainian forces, while the CIA stated that neither the residence nor Putin was the intended target. The situation remains under investigation, with conflicting narratives emerging from different parties involved.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Conduct Drone Operations in Moscow
properties.description: A total blackout occurred in Moscow affecting hundreds of thousands of residents following a wave of drone operations. The specific details regarding the nature of the drone activities and their origin remain unclear.

properties.title: Russian Vessel Detained in Finland
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Finnish authorities detained the vessel Fitburg, which was carrying Russian personnel. The vessel was reported to have damaged an underwater cable prior to the New Year.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Zaporizhzhia
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Russian Forces conducted an attack on Zaporizhzhia, resulting in vehicle fires, damage to buildings, and reported casualties among civilians.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Attempted Strike on Russian Residence
properties.description: Following the rejection of Russia's claims by the United States, Moscow provided evidence of an attempted strike by Ukrainian forces on a residence associated with President Putin. The details of the incident and the nature of the evidence have not been disclosed.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack Hospital in Semenivka, Chernihiv Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russian Forces conducted an attack on a hospital located in Semenivka, Chernihiv Region. The incident resulted in damage to the facility. Further details regarding casualties or operational impacts were not provided.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Allegedly Strike Civilian Area in Kherson Region
properties.description: Reports indicate at least 27 fatalities, including two children, following an alleged strike by Ukrainian Forces in the Kherson region. Additionally, 31 individuals are reported injured, with five being minors. Identification of the deceased may require genetic testing due to the circumstances. Ukrainian authorities have denied involvement in the attack.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Deny Attack on Civilian Area in Kherson Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces have refuted claims made by adversary forces regarding an attack on the village of Khorly in the Kherson region. The Ukrainian military stated that no such strike occurred, countering the assertions of the occupying administration.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Cleanup Operations in Kupiansk
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces are completing cleanup operations in the Kupiansk area. Russian Forces are reportedly preparing for new assaults in the region.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Strike Reported in Occupied Ukraine
properties.description: A drone strike attributed to Ukrainian forces reportedly resulted in 24 fatalities among civilians in an area of Ukraine currently under occupation. This incident occurs amid ongoing peace negotiations and rising tensions in the region.

properties.title: Russian Forces Provide Evidence of Ukrainian Strike Attempt on Putin Residence
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian authorities submitted analyses of drone debris to the United States, claiming it was evidence of an attempted strike by Ukrainian forces on the residence of President Putin. The U.S. had previously rejected Russia's claims regarding the incident.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack Kupiansk
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces conducted operations in Kupiansk, resulting in significant damage to the city. The situation remains under assessment regarding control of the area.

properties.title: Russian Drone Attack on Volyn
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russian forces conducted drone attacks targeting civilian areas in Volyn throughout the New Year's night. The specific impact on civilian infrastructure and casualties is not detailed in the report.

properties.title: Allegations of Civilian Attacks Exchanged between Russia and Ukraine on New Year's Day
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, both Russia and Ukraine reported allegations of civilian attacks. The claims were made amid ongoing tensions and discussions regarding peace negotiations. Specific details regarding the incidents and the number of casualties were not disclosed.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Repel Drone Attacks across Ukraine
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, over 4,000 drones were reported to have targeted Ukraine. On January 2, 2026, Ukrainian Forces repelled an overnight drone attack involving 116 UAVs, with 86 drones shot down or jammed. The strikes impacted 23 sites, with debris falling on 2 locations.

properties.title: Transfer of Evidence Regarding Attack on Putin's Residence
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russia provided the United States with materials related to an alleged attack on the residence of President Putin. The details of the incident remain unclear, and further investigation is ongoing.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Air Strikes in Zaporizhzhia
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian forces targeted the city of Zaporizhzhia with air strikes. Reports indicate that there were no casualties from the attacks. The incident highlights ongoing military actions in the region.

properties.title: Russia and Ukraine Accuse Each Other of Targeting Civilians
properties.description: Both Russia and Ukraine have made allegations against each other regarding the targeting of civilian areas. Ukrainian Defense Forces have denied claims made by the occupying administration about an attack on a village in the Kherson region.

properties.title: Russian Forces Present Evidence of Ukrainian Attack Attempt on Putin's Residence
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russian authorities reported that they provided the United States with materials purportedly demonstrating an attempted attack by Ukrainian forces on the residence of President Putin. The evidence is expected to address any inquiries regarding the incident.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Allegedly Targets Putin Residence
properties.description: Russian authorities reported that a Ukrainian drone targeted the residence of President Vladimir Putin. They provided physical evidence of the incident to the United States for verification. No casualties or damage details were disclosed.

properties.title: Russia Claims Ukrainian Drone Targeted Putin Residence
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, Russian authorities reported that a Ukrainian drone targeted the residence of President Vladimir Putin. Russia has provided physical evidence of the incident to the United States. The details surrounding the event remain under investigation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Attack during New Year Celebrations in Kherson Region
properties.description: A drone attack conducted by Ukrainian forces resulted in 24 civilian casualties during New Year celebrations in the Kherson region. The incident occurred on January 1, 2026.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Reported Incident in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 1, 2026, in the Kherson region, a leader of the occupation police, Sergey Bogan, was reported killed. Following this, on January 2, 2026, Ukrainian Forces denied claims made by Russian Forces regarding an attack on civilians in the same area.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Targeted Russian Presidential Residence in Moscow
properties.description: A Ukrainian drone reportedly aimed at the residence of the Russian President. Russian authorities claim to have intercepted the drone using air defense systems. Evidence related to the incident has been handed over to the United States for further analysis.

properties.title: Unknown Actors Attack on Putin's Residence
properties.description: Reports indicate an attack on the residence of the Russian President. Russian authorities claim to possess evidence related to the incident, including drone debris, which has been shared with the United States. The situation remains under investigation.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Airstrike on Energy Infrastructure in Zaporizhzhia and Dnipro
properties.description: A coordinator of Russian airstrikes targeting energy facilities in Zaporizhzhia and Dnipro has been sentenced to 15 years in prison. The airstrike in Zaporizhzhia occurred on the night of January 2, resulting in damage to infrastructure.

properties.title: Foreign National Killed in Donetsk Region
properties.description: Russell Allan Wilson, a foreign national, was reported killed while engaged in combat operations in the Donetsk region. The circumstances surrounding the incident remain under investigation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drone Targeted Russian Presidential Residence
properties.description: A Ukrainian drone reportedly aimed at a residence associated with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Russian forces claimed to have intercepted and destroyed the drone using air defense systems. The incident occurred as tensions between the two nations continue.

properties.title: Unknown Actor Conducts Attack in Khorly
properties.description: An attack occurred in Khorly on January 2, 2026. The intent behind the attack is reported to be to provoke a response from Russian forces during the New Year celebrations. Details regarding casualties or specific movements of personnel are not provided.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Deny Claims of Civilian Strike in Kherson Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces have refuted allegations made by Russian Forces regarding an attack on civilians in the Kherson region. The situation remains under investigation, with no confirmed casualties reported at this time.

properties.title: Unknown Objects Reported Falling in Tulcea Region
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, authorities in Tulcea issued an alert regarding possible unidentified objects falling from the sky. The Air Forces reported the presence of moving targets approaching the border area between Romania and Ukraine.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Heating Infrastructure in Kherson
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces conducted strikes on heating generation facilities in Kherson, leading to potential disruptions in heating services. Additionally, parts of the city experienced power outages.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Air Strikes in Zaporizhzhia
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian forces targeted the city of Zaporizhzhia with air strikes. No casualties have been reported as a result of these attacks.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Attack near Hrabovske
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces launched an attack in the vicinity of Hrabovske, targeting railway infrastructure. Reports indicate the use of aviation in the area, suggesting an intention to expand their operational front. Ukrainian Forces are monitoring the situation closely.

properties.title: Unknown Actors Allegedly Attack Residence of Russian Leader
properties.description: Reports indicate an attack on the residence of the Russian leader. The Kremlin has suggested that this incident may be a fabricated event aimed at creating discord between the United States and Ukraine. No casualties or specific details regarding the attack have been confirmed.

properties.title: Russian Forces Attack Heating Facility in Kherson
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces conducted strikes on a heating facility in Kherson, Ukraine. Reports indicate potential disruptions to heating services in the city, with some areas experiencing power outages.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Conduct Attack in Kherson
properties.description: An attack occurred in Kherson. It has been reported that Ukrainian forces were not responsible for this action. Further details regarding the involved parties and the nature of the attack are currently unavailable.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Conduct Strikes on Military Targets in Kyiv
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Ukrainian Forces reported that strikes were carried out exclusively targeting military objectives in Kyiv. The operations were aimed at disrupting the capabilities of Russian Forces in the region.

properties.title: Unknown Drones Attack Resulting in Flight Delays in Moscow
properties.description: Approximately 200 flights were delayed in Moscow due to an attack by unknown drones. The capital's airports, including Domodedovo, Vnukovo, and Zhukovsky, are temporarily closed, with limited departures and arrivals. Several flights have been canceled.

properties.title: Tanker QENDIL Ran Aground off the Coast of Turkey
properties.description: The tanker QENDIL, associated with a Russian fleet, ran aground off the coast of Turkey after being in the Mediterranean Sea for two weeks following an attack on December 19. The vessel decided to rest on the shores of Turkey.

properties.title: Unknown Group Car Explosion in Obolonsky District of Kyiv
properties.description: A serviceman sustained shrapnel wounds due to a car explosion in the Obolonsky district of Kyiv. The incident has been classified as a terrorist attack by the prosecutor's office.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Gas Station in Kherson
properties.description: On January 4, 2026, Russian Forces conducted a drone strike on a gas station in Kherson. The attack resulted in a fire involving a gas module and a passenger vehicle. Firefighting efforts were undertaken by rescuers, who faced challenges due to ongoing drone activity in the area.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Maintain Control in Rodynske
properties.description: As of January 4, 2026, Ukrainian Forces, including the 14th brigade 'Chervona Kalyna', the 20th brigade 'Lyubart', and the 132nd separate reconnaissance battalion, are defending the settlement of Rodynske and its approaches. Control over key positions is reported, with Russian Forces sustaining losses in personnel and equipment.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Involved in Incident in Kharkiv
properties.description: In Kharkiv, fragments of a body were discovered under the rubble of a house. Rescue and search operations are currently ongoing at the site.

properties.title: Finnish Border Guard Seizes Vessel Fitburg near Helsinki
properties.description: The Finnish Border Guard conducted a boarding and seizure of the vessel Fitburg, which departed from St. Petersburg. The vessel is suspected of involvement in disruptions of communication cables between Tallinn and Helsinki. Fourteen crew members, including citizens from Russia, Georgia, Azerbaijan, and Kazakhstan, were questioned. Two crew members have been detained, and two others are prohibited from leaving Finland as part of the ongoing investigation.
properties.ai_reasoning:
[EN] The seizure of the Fitburg underscores Finland's heightened vigilance against maritime threats, particularly those linked to Russia, amid regional tensions over critical infrastructure security. Detaining crew members signals Finland's intent to disrupt potential sabotage operations targeting undersea communication cables, which are vital for NATO's Baltic Sea communications. This incident amplifies concerns over Russia's covert maritime activities in the region, aligning with broader NATO efforts to counter hybrid threats.

properties.title: U.S. Forces Conduct Strikes in Venezuela
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, U.S. forces conducted strikes on military facilities in Venezuela. U.S. Delta Force captured Nicolás Maduro and his wife. Reports indicate that Maduro's capture may have been a negotiated exit. Additionally, a missile attack in Kharkiv resulted in civilian casualties, including a 22-year-old woman and her 3-year-old son.

properties.title: Russian Strikes Result in Casualties in Kharkiv
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, Russian forces conducted strikes in Kharkiv, resulting in three confirmed fatalities and approximately 30 injuries. Fragments of a body were discovered at the site. Rescue and search operations are ongoing.
properties.ai_reasoning:
[EN] The strike demonstrates Russia's continued willingness to target urban centers, undermining Ukraine's morale and straining emergency services. The moderate kinetic score (6) suggests a deliberate but not overwhelming attack, likely aimed at maintaining pressure rather than achieving a decisive outcome. This fits Russia's broader strategy of attrition, weakening Ukraine's resilience over time.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Tamanneftgaz Oil Terminal in Krasnodar Krai
properties.description: FP-2 drones targeted the Tamanneftgaz oil terminal in Krasnodar Krai, resulting in damage to marine oil infrastructure. Satellite imagery indicates burnt pipelines leading to the berths, which are confirmed to be out of service.
properties.ai_reasoning:

This escalation risks provoking more aggressive Russian retaliation, including potential strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure. The attack aligns with Kyiv's strategy to degrade Russia's logistical and economic capacity, though long-term impact depends on Russia's ability to repair and defend such facilities.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Belarusian-Chinese Missile Complex in Crimea
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, Ukrainian Forces targeted the Belarusian-Chinese missile complex 'Polonaise' in Crimea. The GUR reported that the initial strike was aimed at the S-300V air defense system.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Face Logistical Challenges in Lyman Direction
properties.description: In the Lyman direction, logistical operations are severely impacted. Crossings are being destroyed by airstrikes, and restoration efforts are hindered by ongoing strikes. The presence of adversary drones is significant, limiting transportation options, and personnel are forced to move on foot.

properties.title: U.S. Military Operation Results in Abduction of Venezuelan President
properties.description: On January 4, 2026, a U.S. military operation led to the abduction of the Venezuelan President and his spouse. The operation involved rapid strikes and helicopter incursions, facilitated by an extensive intelligence network within Venezuela. The international community's response was limited, with no significant actions taken against the U.S. involvement.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Military Targets in Ukraine
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, Russian Forces targeted military sites in various regions of Ukraine. In Mykolaiv Oblast, water and electricity supply disruptions occurred following strikes. Ukrainian Forces conducted several attacks on southern regions of Russia, which were intercepted by air defense systems. The adversary expanded control in the right bank area of Kupiansk, while Russian Forces maintained control over the industrial zone in the northeastern part of the city.

properties.title: Russian Forces Advance near Sloviansk Direction
properties.description: Heavy fighting continues west of Siversk as Russian Forces advance along multiple front sections. They are pushing towards key supply routes and engaging Ukrainian Forces near Fedorivka and Babachyi Forest. Control over these areas is contested, with both sides experiencing difficulties in maintaining positions due to UAV operations. The overall situation remains tense.

properties.title: Russian Forces Expand Control in Kupiansk Area
properties.description: The situation in Kupiansk remains complex. Russian Forces have maintained positions in the industrial zone on the left bank of the Oskol River, while adversary forces are gradually expanding their control on the right bank. Adversary groups have reached the district court building in central Kupiansk. Russian drone operations are impacting adversary movements, which are primarily conducted in small groups.

properties.title: Russian Forces Establish Control in Mirnograd and Rodinskoe
properties.description: As of December 27, Russian Forces gained full control over Mirnograd, capturing remaining Ukrainian personnel. Concurrently, Ukrainian Forces attempted to break through to their units but faced significant resistance. Following the establishment of a foothold, Russian Forces began evacuating civilians from the area. Attacks by Ukrainian Forces on Rodinskoe diminished as they expended considerable reserves.

properties.title: Unknown Forces Conduct Strikes in Kharkiv Region
properties.description: On January 3, 2025, and January 4, 2026, explosions were reported in the Kharkiv region of Ukraine. The source indicates the involvement of unmanned aerial vehicles, specifically Geran/Gerbera types. Details regarding casualties or damage remain unspecified.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes in Ukraine
properties.description: On January 3-4, 2026, Russian Forces conducted multiple strikes across various regions in Ukraine, including Donbas, Sumy, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Kherson. The strikes involved various munitions and targeted areas such as Slavyansk, Vasylivka, and Chernihiv. Reports indicate numerous explosions throughout the specified regions during both day and night.

properties.title: Russian Forces Strike Artillery Position in Kherson Region
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, a pilot operating a fiber-optic FPV drone recorded the destruction of a Ukrainian artillery piece by a loitering munition known as 'Lancet' in the Kherson region. The incident occurred during the autumn of 2025.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Strikes in Ukraine
properties.description: On January 2-3, 2026, Russian Forces conducted strikes across various regions in Ukraine, including Donbas, Sumy, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Kherson. Reports indicate multiple explosions in areas such as Kupiansk, Svyatohirsk, and near Kyiv. The strikes involved various munitions and targeted both urban and rural locations.

properties.title: Russian Forces Retook Control of Podoly in Kharkiv Region
properties.description: On January 4, 2026, Russian Forces reported the retaking of control over the settlement of Podoly in the Kharkiv region. No specific details regarding casualties or further military movements were provided.

properties.title: Ukrainian Drones Engaged Over Russian Territory
properties.description: On January 4, 2026, a total of 132 Ukrainian drones were reported downed over various regions of Russia. The breakdown includes: 37 in Bryansk, 26 in Kursk, 12 each in Ryazan, Belgorod, and Kaluga, 11 in Moscow, 8 in Voronezh, 6 in Tula, 4 in Lipetsk, 2 in Oryol, and 1 each in Rostov and Tambov. Additionally, drone activity led to significant flight delays in Moscow.

The high T.I.E. scores suggest a strategic shift towards more aggressive and high-impact tactics, potentially aiming to destabilize key regions and undermine Russian air defense capabilities. This event underscores a broader strategy to exert pressure on Russian military and civilian systems, aiming to create operational chaos and degrade logistical networks.

properties.title: Finland Seizes Russian Vessel Fitburg in Gulf of Finland
properties.description: On December 31, 2025, Finnish authorities intercepted the Russian vessel Fitburg in the Gulf of Finland. The ship was linked to damage to undersea telecom cables between Finland and Estonia. The crew of 14 personnel was detained for questioning at Kantvik port.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Maintain Control of Rodynske
properties.description: As of January 4, 2026, Ukrainian Forces, including the 1st Corps Azov, the 14th and 20th Operational Brigades, and the 132nd Recon Battalion, confirmed their control over Rodynske. This statement counters claims made by Russian Forces regarding the occupation of the area.
properties.ai_reasoning:

This move is crucial for maintaining morale and legitimacy on the international stage.

properties.title: Russian Forces Remaining in Kupyansk
properties.description: Fewer than 100 Russian troops are reported to remain in Kupyansk, Kharkiv region. The clearing operation is nearing completion, with remaining personnel primarily located in basements in the central and northwestern areas of the city. Russian commanders have reportedly received orders to retake the city by February.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Strike Tamanneftegaz Oil Terminal in Krasnodar Region
properties.description: FP-2 drones targeted the Tamanneftegaz oil terminal in Russia’s Krasnodar region, resulting in damage to maritime infrastructure. Satellite imagery indicates scorched pipelines leading to the piers, which are confirmed to be out of operation.

properties.title: U.S. Forces Strike Venezuelan Military Targets
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, U.S. forces conducted airstrikes on military facilities in Venezuela, resulting in the destruction of a Venezuelan Buk-M2E air defense system. Additionally, U.S. Delta Force captured Nicolás Maduro and his wife during the operation.

properties.title: Russian Forces Deploy Robotic Systems on Vovchansk Axis
properties.description: On January 3, 2026, Russian forces deployed two ground robotic systems, one armed and one for logistics, on the Vovchansk axis. Both systems were identified and neutralized by the 'Murchyky' drone unit of Ukrainian Forces' 57th Brigade.

properties.title: Russian Forces Conduct Attack near Hrabovske
properties.description: On January 2, 2026, Russian Forces launched an attack targeting railway infrastructure above Hrabovske. The operation included aerial support, indicating an intention to expand their control in this section of the front as a disruptive action.

properties.title: Russian Forces Consolidate Control North of Oleksandro-shultyne
properties.description: Russian Forces have established a significant presence in an area north of Oleksandro-shultyne, previously occupied by Ukrainian Forces until last month. The control in this region is limited due to its open nature, which Russian Forces are utilizing to attempt infiltration towards the southern part of the city.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Confirm Presence in Rodynske
properties.description: On January 4, 2026, the 1st Corps of the National Guard of Ukraine, including the 14th Brigade 'Chervona Kalina' and the 20th Brigade 'Lubart', along with the 132nd Reconnaissance Battalion, refuted claims by Russian forces regarding the occupation of Rodynske, demonstrating the presence of their infantry in the northern part of the village.

properties.title: Car Explosion Reported in Kyiv
properties.description: A car explosion occurred in the Obolonsky district of Kyiv, resulting in shrapnel wounds to a serviceman. Local authorities are investigating the incident, which has been classified as a terrorist attack. Emergency services, including police and bomb disposal units, responded to the scene.

properties.title: Finnish Border Guard Intercepts Vessel near Helsinki
properties.description: The Finnish Border Guard released footage of the boarding and seizure of the vessel Fitburg, which departed from Saint Petersburg. The ship is suspected of involvement in communication cable disruptions between Tallinn and Helsinki. Fourteen crew members, including citizens from Russia, Georgia, Azerbaijan, and Kazakhstan, were interrogated. Two crew members were arrested, and two others were prohibited from leaving Finland as part of the investigation.

properties.title: Ukrainian Forces Attack on Russian Logistics Column in Donetsk Region
properties.description: Ukrainian Forces conducted an attack on a logistics column of Russian Forces in the Donetsk region. The operation resulted in damage to the targeted units. Specific details regarding casualties or equipment losses were not disclosed.
